document_title: Security update for the Linux Kernel

document_notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
document_notes.title: Topic

document_notes.text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 11 SP4 kernel was updated to fix one security issue.

This security bug was fixed:

- CVE-2016-5195: Local privilege escalation using MAP_PRIVATE. It is reportedly exploited in the wild (bsc#1004418).

notes.text: Race condition in mm/gup.c in the Linux kernel 2.x through 4.x before 4.8.3 allows local users to gain privileges by leveraging incorrect handling of a copy-on-write (COW) feature to write to a read-only memory mapping, as exploited in the wild in October 2016, aka "Dirty COW."
